CustomDataType.description: This class does not get 'AdditionalProperties = false' in the schema generation, so it can be extended with arbitrary JSON properties to allow adding custom data.

MonitorEnumType.description: The type of this monitor, e.g. a threshold, delta or periodic monitor.

name.description: Name of the component. Name should be taken from the list of standardized component names whenever possible. Case Insensitive. strongly advised to use Camel Case.

instance.description: Name of instance in case the component exists as multiple instances. Case Insensitive. strongly advised to use Camel Case.

EVSEType.description:
EVSE
urn:x-oca:ocpp:uid:2:233123
Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment

id.description:
Identified_ Object. MRID. Numeric_ Identifier
urn:x-enexis:ecdm:uid:1:569198
EVSE Identifier. This contains a number (> 0) designating an EVSE of the Charging Station.

connectorId.description: An id to designate a specific connector (on an EVSE) by connector index number.

MonitoringDataType.description: Class to hold parameters of SetVariableMonitoring request.

VariableMonitoringType.description: A monitoring setting for a variable.

transaction.description: Monitor only active when a transaction is ongoing on a component relevant to this transaction.

value.description:
Value for threshold or delta monitoring.
For Periodic or PeriodicClockAligned this is the interval in seconds.

severity.description:
The severity that will be assigned to an event that is triggered by this monitor. The severity range is 0-9, with 0 as the highest and 9 as the lowest severity level.

The severity levels have the following meaning: +
*0-Danger* +
Indicates lives are potentially in danger. Urgent attention is needed and action should be taken immediately. +
*1-Hardware Failure* +
Indicates that the Charging Station is unable to continue regular operations due to Hardware issues. Action is required. +
*2-System Failure* +
Indicates that the Charging Station is unable to continue regular operations due to software or minor hardware issues. Action is required. +
*3-Critical* +
Indicates a critical error. Action is required. +
*4-Error* +
Indicates a non-urgent error. Action is required. +
*5-Alert* +
Indicates an alert event. Default severity for any type of monitoring event.  +
*6-Warning* +
Indicates a warning event. Action may be required. +
*7-Notice* +
Indicates an unusual event. No immediate action is required. +
*8-Informational* +
Indicates a regular operational event. May be used for reporting, measuring throughput, etc. No action is required. +
*9-Debug* +
Indicates information useful to developers for debugging, not useful during operations.

name.description: Name of the variable. Name should be taken from the list of standardized variable names whenever possible. Case Insensitive. strongly advised to use Camel Case.

instance.description: Name of instance in case the variable exists as multiple instances. Case Insensitive. strongly advised to use Camel Case.

requestId.description: The id of the GetMonitoringRequest that requested this report.

tbc.description: “to be continued” indicator. Indicates whether another part of the monitoringData follows in an upcoming notifyMonitoringReportRequest message. Default value when omitted is false.

seqNo.description: Sequence number of this message. First message starts at 0.

generatedAt.description: Timestamp of the moment this message was generated at the Charging Station.
